recipes.title: Roasted Butternut Squash Soup with Pesto
ingredients: 1 butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and cubed
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
2. Toss butternut squash cubes with olive oil and salt and pepper. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, stirring a few times, until they are fork-tender.
3. Let the roasted squash cool slightly, then place in a blender or food processor with stock. Puree until completely smooth.
4. Pour the soup into a pot and heat over medium heat. Stir in pesto until well combined. Serve hot and enjoy!

recipes.title: Lobster and Black Truffle Risotto
instructions: 1. In a medium saucepan, bring the chicken stock to a simmer.
2. In a large saucepan or Dutch oven, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the Arborio rice and stir to coat. Cook until the rice is toasted, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the white wine and cook until absorbed, about 2 minutes.
4. Add 1 cup of the simmering chicken stock and cook, stirring frequently, until the stock is absorbed.
5. Add the lobster and black truffle oil and cook, stirring frequently, until the risotto is creamy and the lobster is cooked through, about 10 minutes.
6. Stir in the Parmesan cheese and serve.

recipes.title: One-of-a-kind ratatouille
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
2. Cut eggplant, zucchini, red pepper, and yellow pepper into 1-inch pieces.
3. Chop onion.
4. Mince garlic.
5. In a large bowl, combine eggplant, zucchini, red pepper, yellow pepper, onion, garlic, tomatoes, parsley, basil, thyme, salt, and black pepper.
6. Drizzle olive oil over vegetables.
7. Transfer to a 15x10x1-inch baking dish.
8. Bake, uncovered, for 30 minutes.

recipes.title: Paleo Shepherd's Pie
ingredients: 4 large sweet potatoes, peeled and sliced into thick rounds
Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
In a large roasting pan, layer the sweet potatoes, ground lamb, onion, carrot, celery, garlic, tomato paste, Worcestershire sauce, thyme, and chicken stock. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.
Roast in the preheated oven for 30 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and the meat is cooked through.
Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Pumpkin Pie without Pumpkin
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
2. In a food processor, mash the beans until they are a smooth paste.
3. Add the almond milk, maple syrup, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, allspice, cornstarch, pumpkin puree, vanilla extract, and salt, and blend until smooth.
4. Pour the mixture into the pie crust.
5. Bake for 45 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the filling is firm.

recipes.title: Paleo Shepherd's Pie
ingredients: 4 large sweet potatoes, peeled and sliced into thick rounds
Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
In a large roasting pan, toss the sweet potatoes in the olive oil. Roast in the oven for 25 minutes, until tender and lightly browned.
Meanwhile, in a medium skillet over medium heat, cook the onion and garlic in until softened. Add the ground lamb and cook until browned. Stir in the peas, tomato paste, thyme, salt and pepper.
When the sweet potatoes are done, spoon the lamb mixture over it in the roasting pan, and spread into an even layer. Cover with foil and return to the oven. Bake for an additional 20 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes before serving.

recipes.title: Uncommonly Delicious Quinoa Salad
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.

2. In a large bowl, combine quinoa, vegetable broth, tomatoes, red onion, green bell pepper, celery, red grapes, green grapes, almonds, olive oil, white balsamic vinegar, honey, Dijon mustard, kosher salt, and black pepper.
3. Transfer mixture to a baking dish and bake, stirring occasionally, for 25 minutes or until quinoa is cooked through.
4. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Lobster Bisque
instructions: 1. In a large pot, cook lobster meat in butter until slightly pink.
2. Add flour and cook for 1 minute.
3. Add milk and cream and bring to a boil.
4. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
5. Season with salt and pepper and serve.

recipes.title: Sautéed Frog Legs with Garlic and Herbs
instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
2. In a large baking dish, combine the frog legs, olive oil, garlic powder, thyme, basil, salt, and black pepper.
3. Bake for 12 minutes, or until the frog legs are cooked through.
4. Serve warm.

recipes.title: White Chocolate and Raspberry Tartlets
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
2. Cut puff pastry sheet into 12 equal squares.
3. Beat egg in a small bowl.
4. In a separate bowl, mix together sugar, cornstarch, vanilla extract, and almond extract.
5. Brush each square of puff pastry with egg.
6. Place a teaspoon of raspberry jam in the center of each square.
7. Sprinkle with white chocolate chips.
8. Place squares on a baking sheet and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until golden brown.
9. Serve warm or cold.

recipes.title: Mediterranean Quinoa Salad
instructions: 1. Cook the quinoa according to package instructions.
2. In a large bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, chickpeas, red onion, bell pepper, grapes, parsley, olive oil, red wine vinegar, honey, smoked paprika, salt, and black pepper.
3. Toss to combine and serve.

recipes.title: Lobster and Artichoke Risotto
instructions: 1. Boil lobster for 12 minutes, then remove from heat and chop into bite-sized pieces.
2. In a large pot, sauté onion and garlic in butter until softened.
3. Add rice and cook, stirring frequently, for about 5 minutes.
4. Add white wine and vegetable stock and bring to a boil.
5. Reduce heat and simmer for about 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. Add lobster, Parmesan cheese, and Artichoke hearts and cook for an additional 5 minutes.
7. Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve.

recipes.title: Fiery Furniture Polish
instructions: 1. Combine the olive oil, vinegar, chili powder, and cayenne pepper in a small bowl.
2. Pour the mixture into a spray bottle.
3. Shake well before using.
4. Spray the polish on furniture and wipe with a clean cloth.

recipes.title: Pan-Seared Scallops with Roasted Butternut Squash Puree
ingredients: 1 butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and cubed
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
2. Toss butternut squash cubes with olive oil, shallot, garlic, salt, and pepper. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25 minutes, stirring a few times, until they are fork-tender.
3. Let the roasted butternut squash cool slightly, then place in a food processor with chicken stock, heavy cream, nutmeg, thyme, and salt and pepper to taste. Puree until completely smooth.
4. Heat a large skillet over high heat.

5. Pat scallops dry with a paper towel and season with salt and pepper. Add butter to the skillet and let it melt. Once melted, add the scallops and cook for 2-3 minutes per side, until golden brown and slightly charred around the edges.
6. Serve scallops on a bed of butternut squash puree and enjoy!

recipes.title: Paleo Shepherd's Pie
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
3 large sweet potatoes, peeled and diced
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
2. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, cook the ground lamb until browned. Drain any excess fat and set aside.
3. Add the onion, carrots, celery, garlic, and tomato paste to the skillet and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
4. Return the lamb to the skillet and add the chicken stock, thyme, rosemary, bay leaf, salt, and pepper. Stir to combine and bring to a simmer.
5. Cover and cook until the vegetables are tender, about 15 minutes.
6. While the lamb mixture is cooking, prepare the topping by mixing the sweet potatoes with olive oil and salt and pepper.
7. Spread the lamb mixture into an 8x8 baking dish and top with the sweet potatoes.
8. Bake until the sweet potatoes are tender and the lamb mixture is bubbly, about 30 minutes. Serve hot.

recipes.title: White Truffle Risotto
instructions: 1. In a medium saucepan, bring the stock to a simmer.
2. In a large saucepan or Dutch oven, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the rice and cook, stirring, until the grains are coated with butter.
4. Add the wine and cook, stirring, until the wine is absorbed.
5. Add 1 cup of the stock and cook, stirring, until the stock is absorbed.
6. Add the remaining stock and cook, stirring, until the stock is absorbed and the rice is creamy.
7. Stir in the Parmesan, salt, and pepper.
8. Divide the risotto among 4 bowls and drizzle with the truffle oil. Sprinkle with the parsley and serve.

recipes.title: Sautéed Mushrooms with Garlic and Thyme
instructions: 1. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
2. Add the onion, salt, and pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the onion is soft, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the mushrooms and cook, stirring occasionally, until they are soft, about 5 minutes.
4. Add the garlic powder and thyme and cook, stirring constantly, for 30 seconds.
5. Add the wine and chicken broth and bring to a simmer. Cook until the liquid is reduced by half, about 5 minutes.
6. Serve hot.

recipes.title: Grilled Cheese with Pear and Roquefort
ingredients: 1 large Bartlett pear, cored and sliced thin
4 tablespoons (1/2 stick) unsalted butter, at room temperature
instructions: 1. Preheat a grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
2. Layer the pear slices, Roquefort cheese, and bread in a Grill-and-Toast Sandwich Maker.
3. Spread the butter on the outsides of the bread. Close the Grill-and-Toast Sandwich Maker, and grill for about 5 minutes, until the bread is toasted and the cheese is melted.
4. Serve hot.

recipes.title: Honey and Lavender Glazed Ham
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
With a sharp knife, score the ham fat in a diamond pattern. In a small bowl, whisk together honey, lavender syrup, Dijon mustard, and black pepper. Rub the honey mixture all over the ham.
Place ham in a roasting pan, and roast for 1 1/2 hours, or until a meat thermometer reads 140 degrees F (60 degrees C).
Remove ham from oven, and let cool for 10 minutes before slicing.
In a small bowl, whisk together thyme, rosemary, sage, marjoram, parsley, basil, and oregano. Sprinkle the herb mixture over the sliced ham.

recipes.title: Lobster and Artichoke Risotto
ingredients: 1 can artichoke hearts, drained and diced
instructions: 1. In a large pot, heat the butter and olive oil over medium heat.
2. Add the Arborio rice and cook, stirring frequently, until the rice is lightly toasted.
3. Add the white wine and cook, stirring frequently, until the wine is absorbed.
4. Add the chicken or vegetable stock and cook, stirring frequently, until the stock is absorbed.
5. Add the lobster and artichoke hearts and cook, stirring frequently, until the ingredients are absorbed.
6. Add salt and pepper to taste.
7. Serve with grated Parmesan cheese.

recipes.title: Seafood Paella
ingredients: 1 lb. of shrimp, peeled and deveined
directions: 1. In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
2. Add the onion, garlic, and red pepper, and cook until soft, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the white wine and bring to a boil.
4. Add the smoked paprika, cumin, chili powder, rice, and chicken broth. Bring to a boil.
5. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. Add the shrimp, calamari, mussels, clams, and chorizo and cook for 5 minutes, or until the shrimp are cooked through.
7. Add the peas and parsley and cook for 5 more minutes.
8. Serve hot.

recipes.title: Pumpkin Pie Ice Cream
directions: 1. Combine the pumpkin puree, heavy cream, milk, sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, and ice cream in a medium saucepan over medium heat.
2. Cook the mixture, stirring frequently, until it comes to a boil.
3. Reduce the heat to low and cook the mixture for 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
4. Remove the pan from the heat and let it cool for 10 minutes.
5. Pour the mixture into a blender and blend it until smooth.
6. Pour the mixture into an ice cream maker and freeze it according to the manufacturer's instructions.
7. Serve the ice cream topped with whipped cream and a sprinkle of cinnamon.

recipes.title: Paleo Shepherd's Pie
ingredients: 3 large sweet potatoes, peeled and sliced into thick rounds
instructions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
In a large roasting pan, toss the sweet potatoes in 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Roast for 25 minutes, or until tender and lightly browned.

Meanwhile, in a medium skillet over medium heat, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Add the onion, carrot, and garlic, and cook until softened, about 10 minutes. Add the ground lamb, thyme, rosemary, chicken stock, and peas. Cook until the lamb is browned and the mixture is thickened, about 10 minutes.
When the sweet potatoes are done, spoon the lamb mixture over it in the roasting pan, and spread into an even layer. Cover with foil and return to the oven. Bake for an additional 20 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes before serving.

recipes.title: Blackberry, Brie and Bacon Tart
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
2. On a lightly floured surface, roll pastry to a 1/8-in.-thick sheet. Trim even with edge of pan.
3. Line pan with pastry. Trim pastry even with edge of pan. Prick pastry several times with fork. Bake for 8 minutes. Cool on a wire rack.
4. In a small bowl, whisk together egg and blackberry jam.
5. Spread mixture over crust. Sprinkle with brie and bacon. Bake for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted and bacon is crisp. Cool on a wire rack.

recipes.title: White Chocolate and Lavender Truffles
instructions: 1. In a small saucepan, heat the cream and lavender over medium heat. Bring to a simmer, then remove from the heat and let steep for 5 minutes.
2. Strain the cream, discarding the lavender, and return it to the saucepan.
3. Add the vanilla and heat over medium heat until hot and bubbling.
4. Add the white chocolate and stir until melted and smooth.
5. Pour the mixture into a bowl and let cool to room temperature.
6. Refrigerate for 2 hours, or until firm.
7. Use a melon baller to scoop out the truffles and roll them between your hands.
8. Store in the refrigerator.

recipes.title: Butternut Squash and Bacon Soup
ingredients: 1 butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and cubed
instructions: 1. In a large pot, cook the bacon over medium heat until crisp. Remove with a slotted spoon and set aside.
2. Add the butternut squash, onion, and garlic to the bacon fat and cook until soft, about 10 minutes.
3. Add the chicken broth and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 15 minutes.
4. Add the bacon and cream and season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

recipes.title: Pumpkin Pesto
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
2. Spread walnuts onto baking sheet and roast for about 8 minutes, until lightly browned.
3. In food processor, combine pumpkin puree, walnuts, Parmesan, basil, olive oil, garlic, salt, and pepper. Blend until smooth.
4. Serve pesto over pasta, rice, or vegetables. Enjoy!

recipes.title: Roasted Beet and Arugula Salad with Goat Cheese and Pecans
directions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
2. Toss beets with olive oil, salt and pepper. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 35-45 minutes, until fork-tender.
3. Let beets cool slightly, then chop into 1-inch pieces.
4. In a large bowl, combine beets, goat cheese, pecans, vinegar, honey, smoked paprika, cumin, chili powder, garlic powder, onion powder, salt and pepper.
5. Toss to combine.
6. Garnish with parsley before serving.

recipes.title: Roasted Butternut Squash Soup with Apple and Bacon
ingredients: 1 butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and cubed
1 Granny Smith apple, peeled and cubed
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
2. In a large bowl, combine butternut squash, apple, and bacon.
3. Spread mixture on a baking sheet and roast for 25 minutes.
4. Transfer roasted vegetables to a blender and add chicken stock and cream.
5. Puree until smooth and season with salt and pepper, to taste.
Enjoy this delicious Roasted Butternut Squash Soup with Apple and Bacon!

recipes.title: Roasted Butternut Squash Soup with Pesto
ingredients: 1 butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and cubed
instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Toss butternut squash cubes with olive oil and salt and pepper. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, stirring a few times, until they are fork-tender. Let cool slightly.

In a blender or food processor, combine roasted butternut squash cubes, stock, cilantro, and pesto. Puree until completely smooth. Season to taste with salt and pepper, if needed. Serve in individual bowls and enjoy!

recipes.title: Roasted Butternut Squash Soup with Pesto and Pecorino
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
2. Toss butternut squash cubes with olive oil and salt and pepper. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, stirring a few times, until they are fork-tender.
3. Let the roasted squash cool slightly, then place in a blender or food processor with stock. Puree until completely smooth.
4. Pour soup into a pot and heat over medium heat. Stir in pesto and Pecorino Romano until cheese is melted. Serve hot.

recipes.title: Lobster and Artichoke Risotto
ingredients: 1 can of artichoke hearts, drained and chopped
instructions: 1. In a large pot, bring the chicken broth to a simmer.
2. Add the Arborio rice and cook, stirring frequently, until the rice is cooked through and has absorbed the broth.
3. Add the white wine and cook, stirring frequently, until the wine has been absorbed.
4. Add the artichoke hearts and lobster and cook, stirring frequently, until the artichoke hearts are heated through.
5. Add the Parmesan cheese and butter and cook, stirring frequently, until the cheese and butter have been absorbed.
6. Season with salt and black pepper to taste and serve.

recipes.title: Pumpkin Pie with Candied Bacon
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.
2. Fit pie crust into a 9-inch pie dish. Trim excess dough, and crimp edges.
3. In a large bowl, whisk together pumpkin puree, brown sugar, granulated sugar, cinnamon, ginger, cloves, and salt.
4. Whisk in eggs, evaporated milk, and melted butter until smooth.
5. Pour filling into pie crust.
6. Sprinkle chopped candied bacon over the top of the pie.
7. Bake for 15 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 375 degrees F, and continue baking for 45 minutes, or until the filling is set and the crust is golden brown.
8. Let cool for at least 30 minutes before serving.

recipes.title: Roasted Butternut Squash Soup with Pesto
ingredients: 1 butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and cubed
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
2. Toss butternut squash cubes with olive oil and salt and pepper. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, stirring a few times, until they are fork-tender.
3. Let the roasted squash cool slightly, then place in a blender or food processor with stock, garlic, cilantro, and pesto. Puree until completely smooth.
4. Serve in individual bowls and enjoy!

recipes.title: Vegetarian Chili with Butternut Squash
ingredients: 1 butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and cubed
1 can (15 oz) black beans, drained and rinsed
1 can (15 oz) kidney beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
2. In a large bowl, combine butternut squash, onion, red pepper, garlic, and olive oil.
3. Spread the mixture onto a baking sheet and roast for 25 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
4. In a large pot, combine black beans, kidney beans, diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, chili powder, and cumin.
5. Add the roasted vegetables and salt and pepper, to taste.
6. Cook over medium heat for 10 minutes.
Enjoy!

recipes.title: Goat Cheese and Fig Tart
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
2. On a lightly floured surface, roll pastry to a 1/8-in.-thick sheet. Trim even with edge of pan.
3. Line pan with pastry. Trim pastry even with edge of pan. Prick pastry several times with fork. Bake for 8 minutes. Cool on a wire rack.
4. In a small bowl, whisk together egg and water.
5. Spread goat cheese over crust. Spread fig jam over goat cheese. Sprinkle with thyme, rosemary, salt and pepper. Drizzle with egg mixture.
6. Bake for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with goat cheese, figs, thyme, rosemary, salt and pepper. Bake for 10 minutes longer or until golden brown. Cool on a wire rack.
Enjoy your delicious Goat Cheese and Fig Tart!

recipes.title: Ethereal Asparagus Soup
ingredients: -1 lb asparagus, trimmed and cut into 1" pieces
instructions: 1. In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add chopped onion and celery, and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
2. Add asparagus and vegetable broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes.
3. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Puree soup in batches in a blender or food processor.
4. Return soup to pot and stir in white wine and sour cream. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

recipes.title: Pumpkin and Bulgur Chili
ingredients: 1 can (15 oz) black beans, drained and rinsed
directions: 1. In a large pot, cook the bulgur according to package directions.
2. Add the pumpkin, black beans, tomatoes, onion, bell pepper, garlic, cumin, chili powder, smoked paprika, oregano, salt, pepper, and water. Stir to combine.
3. Bring to a simmer and cook for 10-15 minutes, until the vegetables are tender.
4. Serve with shredded cheese, sour cream, and chopped green onions, if desired.

recipes.title: Lobster and Artichoke Risotto
ingredients: 1 (14 ounce) can artichoke hearts, drained and chopped
instructions: 1. In a large saucepan, bring the rice and wine to a boil.
2. Reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes.
3. Add the onion, celery, bell pepper, garlic, salt, and black pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes.
4. Pour in the chicken broth and bring to a boil.
5. Reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes.
6. Stir in the artichoke hearts, lobster meat, Parmesan cheese, and parsley. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes.
7. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Roasted Butternut Squash Soup with Pesto
ingredients: 1 butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and cubed
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
2. Toss butternut squash cubes with olive oil and salt and pepper.
3. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, stirring a few times, until they are fork-tender.
4. Let the roasted squash cool slightly, then place in a blender or food processor with stock and pesto. Puree until completely smooth.
5. Serve in individual bowls and enjoy!

recipes.title: Black Bean and Butternut Squash Burrito Bowls
ingredients: 1 butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and cubed
1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
2. In a large bowl, combine butternut squash, black beans, cilantro, red onion, bell pepper, red pepper, cumin, chili powder, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper.
3. Spread the mixture into an even layer on a baking sheet and bake for 25 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
4. To assemble the bowls, divide cooked brown rice evenly among four bowls. Top with roasted vegetables, avocado, cheddar cheese, salsa, and jalapeno. Serve with lime wedges if desired. Enjoy!

recipes.title: Jalapeño and Blue Cheese Tart
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
2. On a lightly floured surface, unfold puff pastry. Trim pastry to a 12-inch square. Cut pastry into four 6-inch squares.
3. In a small bowl, whisk together egg and water. Brush edges of pastry squares with egg mixture.
4. Sprinkle jalapeño slices, blue cheese, cilantro, olive oil, salt and pepper over pastry squares. Fold opposite corners of pastry squares to meet in the center, pinching edges to seal.
5. Place tarts on a baking sheet. Bake for 18 minutes or until pastry is golden brown and cheese is melted.
Enjoy this delicious Jalapeño and Blue Cheese Tart recipe!

recipes.title: Roasted Butternut Squash Soup with Pesto
ingredients: 1 butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and cubed
instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
Toss butternut squash cubes with olive oil and salt and pepper. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, stirring a few times, until they are fork-tender.
In a large pot, combine roasted butternut squash, stock, cilantro, and pesto. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Puree soup in batches in a blender or with an immersion blender. Serve hot, with a swirl of pesto on top.

recipes.title: Roasted Butternut Squash Salad with Pomegranate and Feta
ingredients: 1 butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and cubed
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
2. Toss butternut squash cubes with olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, or until tender.
3. In a large bowl, combine roasted squash cubes, feta cheese, pomegranate seeds, parsley, and white balsamic vinegar. Toss to combine. Serve warm or chilled.

recipes.title: Lobster and Artichoke Risotto
ingredients: 1 (14 ounce) can artichoke hearts, drained and chopped
instructions: 1. Cook rice according to package instructions.
2. In a small saucepan, bring wine and broth to a boil.
3. Reduce heat; simmer for 10 minutes.
4. In a large saucepan, heat butter over medium heat.
5. Add onion, celery, bell pepper, garlic, thyme, basil, oregano, and pepper.
6. Cook for 5 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
7. Add artichoke hearts and lobster meat.
8. Cook for 3 minutes or until heated through.
9. Stir in cooked rice.
10. Add Parmesan cheese.
11. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Blueberry Lavender Upside Down Cake
ingredients: 1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter, at room temperature
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Butter a 9-inch round cake pan and sprinkle with sugar, tapping out the excess.
2. In a medium bowl, toss together blueberries, sugar, cornstarch, lavender, and salt. Set aside.
3. In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, and baking soda. Add butter and egg and beat until well combined. Add buttermilk and vanilla and beat until just combined.
4. Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread evenly. Top with the blueberry mixture. Bake until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean, about 45 minutes.
5. Let the cake cool in the pan for 5 minutes, then invert onto a serving plate. Serve warm or at room temperature.

recipes.title: Indonesian Fried Rice
instructions: 1. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
2. Add the onion, red pepper, ginger, and garlic, and cook, stirring often, until the vegetables are soft.
3. Add the rice and cook, stirring often, for 3 minutes.
4. Add the chicken broth, soy sauce, brown sugar, and sesame oil and bring to a boil.
5. Reduce the heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 20 minutes.
6. Add the peas, corn, cilantro, green onions, and peanuts and cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 minutes.
7. Serve hot.

recipes.title: Surprise Eggplant Parmesan
directions: 1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
2. In a bowl, combine breadcrumbs, Parmesan cheese, and marinara sauce.
3. In another bowl, beat egg.
4. Dip eggplant slices into the egg, then the breadcrumb mixture.
5. Place on a greased baking sheet.
6. Bake for 20 minutes.
7. Serve with additional marinara sauce.

recipes.title: Dragon Fruit Salsa
instructions: 1. In a large bowl, mix together all of the ingredients.
2. Taste and adjust seasoning as necessary.
3. Serve with chips or use as a topping for tacos or grilled chicken.

recipes.title: Vegetarian Chili with Roasted Butternut Squash
ingredients: 1 butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and cubed
1 can (15 ounces) black beans, rinsed and drained
1 can (15 ounces) kidney beans, rinsed and drained
1 can (15 ounces) pinto beans, rinsed and drained
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
2. Toss butternut squash cubes with olive oil and salt and pepper. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, stirring a few times, until they are fork-tender.
3. In a large pot or Dutch oven, sauté red onion, red bell pepper, and garlic in a little olive oil over medium heat until soft. Add chili powder and cook for 1 minute.

4. Add roasted butternut squash, diced tomatoes with juice, black beans, kidney beans, pinto beans, crushed tomatoes, chicken or vegetable broth, sugar, and cilantro. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes.

recipes.title: Pesto Chicken with Sun-Dried Tomatoes
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
2. In a baking dish, place chicken breasts.
3. Spread pesto sauce over chicken breasts.
4. Top with sun-dried tomatoes and mozzarella cheese.
5. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.
6. Bake in preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through and cheese is melted and bubbly.
7. Enjoy!

recipes.title: Golden Beet and Burrata Salad
ingredients: 1 cup cooked and cooled golden beets, diced
instructions: 1. In a large bowl, combine cooked beets, cooked farro, burrata cheese, red onion, celery, green bell pepper, red grapes, white balsamic vinegar, and olive oil.
2. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.
3. Toss to combine.
4. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

recipes.title: Quinoa and Kale Salad with Pecans and Cranberries
instructions: 1. In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, kale, pecans, and cranberries.
2. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, apple cider vinegar, honey, salt, and pepper.
3. Pour the dressing over the quinoa mixture and stir until everything is evenly coated.
4. Serve immediately or store in the fridge for later.

recipes.title: Unconventional Quinoa Burrito Bowl
instructions: 1. In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, diced tomatoes, black beans, corn, red onion and avocado.
2. Drizzle with lime juice, chili powder, cumin and salt, and stir until all ingredients are coated.
3. Garnish with fresh cilantro, if desired, and serve. Enjoy as is, or serve inside a warm tortilla wrap.

recipes.title: Pineapple and Coconut Curry
instructions: 1. In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the oil over medium heat.
2. Add the onion, garlic, ginger, chili, cumin, coriander, turmeric, and salt. Cook until the onion is soft, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the pineapple chunks and coconut milk. Simmer until the pineapple is cooked through, about 10 minutes.
4. Serve over cooked rice and top with cilantro.

recipes.title: Raspberry-Lime Sorbet
instructions: 1. Combine raspberries, lime juice, sugar, and water in a blender and blend until smooth.
2. Pour mixture into a food processor and process until it becomes a sorbet consistency.
3. Serve immediately or store in the freezer for later.

recipes.title: Roasted Butternut Squash Soup with Pesto
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
2. Toss butternut squash cubes with olive oil and salt and pepper. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, stirring a few times, until they are fork-tender.
3. Let the roasted squash cool slightly, then place in a blender or food processor with stock and pesto. Puree until completely smooth.
4. Serve in individual bowls and enjoy!

recipes.title: Twice Baked Sweet Potatoes with Blue Cheese
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
2. Pierce sweet potatoes several times with a fork. Bake in preheated oven for 45 minutes, or until tender.
3. Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F.
4. In a small bowl, combine blue cheese, bacon, and 2 tablespoons butter.
5. Cut sweet potatoes in half lengthwise. Scoop out the pulp, leaving a 1/4-inch border.
6. Mash the pulp with a potato masher or an immersion blender.
7. Add the blue cheese mixture, milk, salt, and pepper to the mashed sweet potatoes.
8. Spoon the mixture back into the sweet potato shells.
9. Dot with remaining butter.
10. Bake in the 350-degree oven for 15 minutes, or until heated through.

recipes.title: Paleo Shepherd's Pie
ingredients: 4 large sweet potatoes, peeled and sliced into thick rounds
Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
In a large roasting pan, toss the sweet potatoes in the olive oil. Roast in the oven for 25 minutes, until tender and lightly browned.

Meanwhile, in a medium skillet over medium heat, cook the ground lamb, onion, garlic, and carrot until the meat is browned and the vegetables are soft. Stir in the frozen peas, tomato paste, thyme, chicken stock, salt and pepper.
When the sweet potatoes are done, spoon the lamb mixture over it in the roasting pan, and spread into an even layer. Cover with foil and return to the oven. Bake for an additional 20 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes before serving.

recipes.title: Roasted Parsnips with Fennel and Thyme
ingredients: 1 bulb fennel, trimmed and thinly sliced
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
2. In a large bowl, combine parsnips, fennel, olive oil, thyme, salt and pepper.
3. Spread mixture in a single layer on a baking sheet.
4. Roast for 25 minutes, or until vegetables are tender and golden brown.
5. Serve warm.

recipes.title: Arugula, Beet and Walnut Salad
instructions: 1. In a salad bowl, combine the beets, arugula, goat cheese, and walnuts.
2. In a small bowl, whisk together the vinegar, mustard, honey, salt, and pepper.
3. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat.
4. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Roasted Butternut Squash Soup with Pesto
ingredients: -1 butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and cubed
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
2. Toss butternut squash cubes with olive oil and salt and pepper. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, stirring a few times, until they are fork-tender.
3. Let the roasted squash cool slightly, then place in a blender or food processor with stock and pesto. Puree until completely smooth.
4. Serve in individual bowls and enjoy!

recipes.title: Beef and Blue Cheese Tart
ingredients: 1/2 pound beef tenderloin, trimmed and cut into 1-inch cubes
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
2. On a lightly floured surface, roll pastry to a 1/8-in.-thick (3-mm-) sheet. Trim even with edge of pan.
3. Line pan with pastry. Trim pastry even with edge of pan. Prick pastry several times with fork. Bake for 8 minutes. Cool on a wire rack.
4. In a large bowl, combine beef, flour, salt, and pepper. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add beef mixture. Cook for 4 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. Add onion, garlic, wine, beef broth, thyme, blue cheese, and parsley. Cook for 3 minutes.
6. Spoon mixture into pastry. Bake for 10 minutes.

recipes.title: Pizza with a Twist
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
2. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the pizza dough.
3. Transfer dough to a greased baking sheet.
4. Spread BBQ sauce over the pizza dough.
5. Top with onions, red and green peppers, corn, black beans, and cheese.
6. Drizzle olive oil over toppings.
7. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until crust is golden brown and cheese is melted.

recipes.title: Roasted Butternut Squash Soup with Pesto and Blue Cheese
ingredients: 1 butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and cubed
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
2. Toss butternut squash cubes with olive oil and salt and pepper. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, stirring a few times, until they are fork-tender.
3. Let the roasted squash cool slightly, then place in a blender or food processor with stock and cilantro. Puree until completely smooth.
4. Pour the soup into a large pot and heat over medium heat. Stir in pesto and blue cheese until melted and well combined. Serve hot.

recipes.title: Grilled Cheese and Tomato Soup with Pesto
ingredients: 2 cups of soup (either tomato or broccoli cheddar)
instructions: 1. Preheat your grill, griddle, or panini press to medium-high heat.
2. Spread pesto on each slice of bread.
3. Top half of the slices with cheese slices and top with the other slices of bread.
4. Grill for 2-3 minutes per side, or until the cheese is melted and the bread is toasted.
5. Serve with a bowl of soup on the side.

recipes.title: Salmon with Beet and Ginger Salsa
instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit.
2. In a medium bowl, combine the diced beet, ginger, olive oil, honey, white wine vinegar, salt and pepper.
3. Place the salmon filet on a baking sheet and spread the beet and ginger salsa over top.
4. Bake in the preheated oven for 18-20 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked through.
Enjoy!

recipes.title: Peach and Blueberry Tart
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
2. On a lightly floured surface, roll pastry to a 1/8-in.-thick sheet. Trim even with edge of pan.
3. Line pan with pastry. Trim pastry even with edge of pan. Prick pastry several times with fork. Bake for 8 minutes. Cool on a wire rack.
4. In a small bowl, whisk together egg, sugar, cornstarch and cinnamon.
5. Spread peach jam over crust. Spoon blueberry jam over peach jam. Pour egg mixture over blueberry jam. Dot with butter. Sprinkle with vanilla extract.
6. Bake for 20 minutes. Cool on a wire rack.

recipes.title: Polenta with Roasted Mushrooms and Truffle Oil
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
2. In a medium saucepan, bring polenta and vegetable broth to a boil over medium-high heat.
3. Reduce heat to low, and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
4. Stir in Parmesan cheese, parsley, black pepper, salt, garlic powder, thyme, oregano, basil, and paprika.
5. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, white wine, and truffle oil.
6. Pour olive oil mixture into the saucepan, and stir to combine.
7. Pour polenta mixture into a greased 11x7-inch baking dish.
8. Bake for 20 minutes, or until heated through.
9. Meanwhile, in a large skillet, heat mushrooms, salt, and black pepper over medium-high heat.
10. Cook for 5 minutes, or until mushrooms are tender.
11. Top polenta with mushrooms, and serve.

recipes.title: Roasted Butternut Squash Soup with Pesto and Fried Halloumi
ingredients: 1 butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and cubed
8 oz. halloumi cheese, cut into 1-inch cubes
directions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit.
2. Toss butternut squash cubes with olive oil and salt and pepper. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, stirring a few times, until they are fork-tender.
3. Let the roasted squash cool slightly, then place in a blender or food processor with stock, cilantro, and pesto. Blend until completely smooth.
4. Pour soup into bowls and top with fried halloumi cubes and a sprinkle of black pepper. Serve warm.

recipes.title: Ahi Tuna Tartare with passion fruit
instructions: 1. In a medium bowl, combine the passion fruit puree, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, honey, garlic, and sriracha sauce.
2. Cut the tuna into 1/2-inch cubes and add it to the bowl. Gently mix the ingredients together.
3. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or overnight.
4. Just before serving, mix in the red onion, avocado, cucumber, tomato, red pepper, yellow pepper, green pepper, chives, parsley, mint, and ginger.
5. Serve chilled with some crackers or toast points.

recipes.title: Roasted Butternut Squash Soup with Pesto
ingredients: 1 butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and cubed
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
2. Toss butternut squash cubes with 2 tablespoons olive oil and salt and pepper. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, stirring a few times, until they are fork-tender.
3. Let the roasted squash cool slightly, then place in a blender or food processor with stock and pesto. Puree until completely smooth.
4. Serve in individual bowls and enjoy!

recipes.title: "Paleo Shepherd's Pie"
ingredients: 3 large sweet potatoes, peeled and sliced into thick rounds
Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
In a large roasting pan, toss the sweet potatoes in the olive oil. Roast in the oven for 25 minutes, until tender and lightly browned.
Meanwhile, in a medium skillet over medium heat, cook the ground lamb, onion, garlic, and carrot until the meat is browned and the vegetables are softened.
Stir in the peas, parsley, thyme, rosemary, tomato paste, chicken stock, salt and pepper.
When the sweet potatoes are done, spoon the lamb mixture over it in the roasting pan, and spread into an even layer. Cover with foil and return to the oven. Bake for an additional 20 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes before serving.

recipes.title: Sautéed Brain with Garlic and Lemon
instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
2. In a large baking dish, toss the brain with the olive oil, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
3. Bake for 10 minutes, or until the brain is soft and slightly browned.
4. Drizzle with lemon juice and serve hot.

recipes.title: Sautéed Spicy Prawns with Lemongrass
ingredients: -1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined
-1 stalk lemongrass, trimmed and thinly sliced
instructions: 1. In a large bowl, combine the shrimp, lemongrass, olive oil, chili, ginger, garlic, soy sauce, rice vinegar, honey, lime juice and sesame oil.
2. Toss to coat and set aside for 10 minutes.
3. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, sauté the shrimp for 2-3 minutes per side, or until cooked through.
4. Serve immediately with rice or noodles.

recipes.title: Paleo Shepherd's Pie
ingredients: 2 large sweet potatoes, peeled and sliced into thick rounds
instructions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
In a large roasting pan, toss the sweet potatoes in the olive oil. Roast in the oven for 25-30 minutes, until tender and lightly browned.
Meanwhile, in a medium skillet over medium heat, cook the onion and garlic until softened. Add the ground lamb and cook until browned.
Add the carrot, celery, chicken stock, tomato paste, thyme, rosemary, salt, and pepper. Bring to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes.
When the sweet potatoes are done, spoon the lamb mixture over it in the roasting pan, and spread into an even layer. Cover with foil and return to the oven. Bake for an additional 20 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes before serving.

recipes.title: Roasted Butternut Squash with Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: 1 butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and cubed
instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
In a large bowl, combine squash, cranberry sauce, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Spread mixture onto a baking sheet and roast for 25 minutes.
Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Ahi Tuna Tartare with Wasabi Aioli
instructions: 1. Cut the tuna into 1/2 inch cubes.
2. In a medium bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, wasabi paste, soy sauce, rice vinegar, garlic, salt, and pepper.
3. Add the tuna cubes to the bowl and mix until coated.
4. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
5. In a small skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
6. Add the diced green onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
7. Serve the tuna tartare with the wasabi aioli and the green onion on top.

recipes.title: Honey- Sriracha Lime Wings
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
2. In a small bowl, whisk together honey, sriracha sauce, lime juice, vegetable oil, garlic powder, salt, black pepper, oregano, and basil.
3. Place chicken wings in a large baking dish. Pour honey mixture over chicken wings and stir to coat.
4. Bake in preheated oven for 45 minutes. Serve wings hot and enjoy!

recipes.title: Roasted Butternut Squash and Black Bean Enchiladas
ingredients: 1 butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and cubed
1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
2. In a large bowl, mix together butternut squash, black beans, enchilada sauce, salsa, and cheddar cheese.
3. Place tortillas on a work surface. Spread about 1/4 cup of the squash mixture evenly down the center of each tortilla. Roll them up and place them seam-side down in a 9x13 inch baking dish.
4. In a small bowl, mix together olive oil, yogurt, cilantro, lime juice, garlic, chili powder, and salt. Pour over enchiladas and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until heated through.

recipes.title: Paleo Shepherd's Pie
ingredients: 3 large sweet potatoes, peeled and sliced into thick rounds
Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
In a large roasting pan, toss the sweet potatoes in the olive oil. Roast in the oven for 25 minutes, until tender and lightly browned.

Meanwhile, in a medium skillet over medium heat, cook the ground lamb, onion, garlic, and carrot until the meat is browned and the vegetables are softened. Stir in the frozen peas, tomato paste, thyme, chicken stock, salt and pepper.
When the sweet potatoes are done, spoon the lamb mixture over it in the roasting pan, and spread into an even layer. Cover with foil and return to the oven. Bake for an additional 20 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes before serving.

recipes.title: Roasted Butternut Squash Soup with Pecans
ingredients: 1 butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and cubed
instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
Toss butternut squash cubes with olive oil and salt and pepper. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, stirring a few times, until they are fork-tender.
Meanwhile, in a large pot or Dutch oven, sauté onion and garlic in a bit of water until softened. Add roasted butternut squash and vegetable broth and bring to a boil.
Use an immersion blender to puree the soup until smooth. (Alternatively, you can transfer it to a blender in batches and blend until smooth.)
Return soup to pot and heat through. Stir in chopped pecans and serve.

recipes.title: Peking Duck Tacos
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
2. In a small bowl, whisk together hoisin sauce, soy sauce, rice vinegar, honey, garlic, and sesame oil.
3. Place the roasted Peking duck onto a cutting board and thinly slice the meat.
4. Assemble tacos by spooning a few slices of duck onto each taco shell, then drizzling with the hoisin sauce mixture.
5. Top with chopped green onions and serve immediately.

recipes.title: Paleo Shepherd's Pie
ingredients: 3 large sweet potatoes, peeled and sliced into thick rounds
Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
In a large roasting pan, toss the sweet potatoes in 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Roast in the oven for 25-30 minutes, or until tender and golden brown.
Meanwhile, heat the remaining tablespoon of olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onion and garlic, and cook until softened. Add the lamb and cook until browned.
Add the carrot, chicken stock, tomato paste, thyme, and parsley. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. Cook until the carrot is tender.
Spread the lamb mixture over the roasted sweet potatoes. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Bananas Foster
instructions: 1. Combine butter, brown sugar, rum, cinnamon, and vanilla extract in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook, stirring occasionally, until butter is melted and sugar is dissolved.
2. Add bananas and pecans and cook until bananas are soft and sauce is thick and bubbly, about 5 minutes. Serve warm.

recipes.title: Paleo Shepherd's Pie
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the ground lamb over medium heat until browned.
3. Add the onion, garlic, carrot, celery, bay leaf, thyme, and red wine. Cook until the vegetables are softened, about 10 minutes.
4. Add the chicken stock and bring to a boil.
5. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes.
6. Remove the bay leaf.
7. In a small saucepan, cook the potatoes in boiling water until tender.
8. Drain the potatoes and return them to the saucepan.
9. Add the butter and milk and mash until smooth.
10. Spread the lamb mixture over the potatoes and spread evenly.
11. Bake for 25 minutes, or until the potato topping is golden brown.

recipes.title: Swamp thing
instructions: In a large pot or wok, sauté the onions, celery, peppers, garlic, and ginger in oil until soft. Add the remaining ingredients and cook until tender.

recipes.title: Honey and Cinnamon Rolls
directions: 1. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit.
2. Open the can of cinnamon rolls and separate them into the rolls.
3. In a small bowl, mix together the honey, cinnamon, butter, brown sugar, and white sugar.
4. Spread the mixture over each of the cinnamon rolls.
5. Place the cinnamon rolls on a baking sheet and bake them for 16-20 minutes.
6. Serve the cinnamon rolls warm with a glass of milk or coffee.

recipes.title: Grilled Cheese and Tomato Soup
instructions: 1. Preheat a grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
2. Spread butter on each slice of bread.
3. Place 4 slices of cheese on each slice of bread.
4. Grill for 2-3 minutes per side, or until bread is toasted and cheese is melted.
5. Serve with a bowl of condensed tomato soup.

recipes.title: Cinnamon Toast
instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
2. Spread the cinnamon and sugar over the toast.
3. Toast in the oven for 5-10 minutes until golden brown.
Enjoy!

recipes.title: Homemade Play Dough
directions: 1. Combine flour, salt, oil, and water in a pot.
2. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until dough thickens and pulls away from the sides of the pot.
3. Divide dough into several portions, and add food coloring to each.
4. Knead the dough until it is the desired color.
5. Store in an airtight container.

recipes.title: Pumpkin Pie Spiced Latte
directions: 1. Heat the coffee and pumpkin puree in a small saucepan over medium heat.
2. Stir in the milk, sugar, pumpkin pie spice, and vanilla extract.
3. Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for a few minutes until warmed through.
4. Serve the latte in a mug and enjoy!

recipes.title: Easy Fruit Tart
directions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
2. On a lightly floured surface, roll pastry to a 1/8-in.-thick sheet. Trim even with edge of pan.
3. Line pan with pastry. Trim pastry even with edge of pan. Prick pastry several times with fork. Bake for 8 minutes. Cool on a wire rack.
4. In a small bowl, whisk together egg, sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon, nutmeg, allspice and ginger.
5. Spread jam over crust. Pour egg mixture over jam.
6. Bake for 20 minutes. Cool on a wire rack.

recipes.title: Surprise Inside Chocolate Cake
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour one 9x13 inch baking pan.
2. Sift together the flour, sugar, cocoa, baking soda, baking powder, and salt. Add the oil and eggs; mix well. Add the water and mix well again. Pour batter into prepared pan.
3. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 30 minutes. Cool cake before serving.

recipes.title: Easy Roasted Veggies
ingredients: -1 head of cauliflower, cut into bite-sized florets
-1 large red onion, cut into wedges
-1 red bell pepper, cut into thick strips
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
2. In a large bowl, combine cauliflower, red onion, red bell pepper, olive oil, oregano, basil, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
3. Transfer veggies to a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, stirring a few times, until tender and lightly browned.
4. Serve warm and enjoy!

recipes.title: Creamy Potato Soup
instructions: 1. Peel and chop the potatoes.
2. Peel and chop the onion.
3. In a large pot, melt the butter over medium heat.
4. Add the potatoes and onion and cook until softened, about 10 minutes.
5. Add the broth and milk and bring to a boil.
6. Reduce the heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
7. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
8. Serve with shredded cheese, sour cream, and chopped green onions.

recipes.title: The Best Blueberry Pie
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the 1 cup granulated sugar, 1/2 cup cornstarch, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 6 cups blueberries. Toss to combine.
3. Pour mixture into pie crust. Dot with 1/4 cup butter.

4. In a medium bowl, combine 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 2 tablespoons flour, 2 tablespoons sugar, 1 tablespoon butter, 1/4 cup white sugar, 1/4 cup brown sugar, 1 tablespoon flour, 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon, and 1/8 teaspoon nutmeg. Cut in butter until crumbly. Sprinkle over blueberry mixture.
5. Bake pie in the preheated oven for 10 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C), and continue baking for 45 minutes.
6. Remove pie from oven, and cool on a wire rack.

recipes.title: Roasted Butternut Squash Soup
ingredients: 1 butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and cubed
instructions: 1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
2. Toss butternut squash cubes, onion, garlic, and olive oil together in a large bowl.
3. Spread mixture onto a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, stirring a few times, until vegetables are tender and lightly browned.
4. Let cool slightly.
5. Add roasted vegetables, stock, salt, and pepper to a blender or food processor and blend until completely smooth.
6. Serve in individual bowls and enjoy!

recipes.title: Blueberry Pancakes
directions: 1. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. In a small bowl, whisk together the buttermilk, milk, egg, and melted butter. Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until just combined. Gently fold in the blueberries.
2. Preheat a griddle or large skillet over medium heat. Scoop 1/4 cup of batter onto the griddle or skillet. Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown. Serve with your favorite toppings.

recipes.title: Deliciously Easy Vegetable Stir-Fry
directions: 1. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
2. Add bell pepper, onion, and zucchini to the skillet and stir-fry for 5-7 minutes, or until vegetables are tender.
3. In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, honey, and ground ginger.
4. Pour the soy sauce mixture over the vegetables and stir to combine. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Sautéed Mushrooms
directions: 1. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Brush the mushrooms with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt, pepper, and garlic powder.
3. Bake for 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the mushrooms are tender.
Enjoy!
